required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Live Stream of Prehospital point-of Care Ultrasound During Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation
clinical_study.official_title: Live Stream of Prehospital point-of Care Ultrasound During Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation

brief_summary.textblock:
Background: Point-of-care ultrasound (POCUS) has been suggested as a useful tool in out-of-hospital cardiac arrest (OHCA) for diagnosis and treatment of reversible causes. However, in prehospital emergency medicine performing ultrasound and the translation of the findings can be challenging. As new prehospital ultrasound devices offer the possibility for remote supervision, the impact of tele-supervision on the performance of POCUS during OHCA is unclear.
Aims: This prospective observational study aims to evaluate if POCUS with tele-supervision can be performed during CPR without any additional hands-off periods longer than 5 seconds.
Methods: In total 30 patients with OHCA, where POCUS is considered, will be included in this study.

primary_outcome.measure: Hands-off time during prehospital cardiopulmonary resuscitation
primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: The primary outcome of this study evaluates, if POCUS with tele-supervision can be performed during prehospital cardiopulmonary resuscitation without any additional hands-off period longer than 5 seconds

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of real-time supervision of POCUS during cardiopulmonary resuscitation on the duration time of POCUS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Impact of real-time supervision of POCUS during cardiopulmonary resuscitation on the duration time of POCUS

secondary_outcome.measure: Impact of real-time supervision of POCUS during cardiopulmonary resuscitation on changing of diagnosis of suspected cause of out-of-hospital cardiac arrest.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Impact of real-time supervision of POCUS during cardiopulmonary resuscitation on changing of diagnosis of suspected cause of out-of-hospital cardiac arrest.

arm_group.description: Point-of-care ultrasound of patients with a out-of-hospital cardiac arrest will be performed with tele-supervision.

intervention.description: Point-of-care ultrasound of patients with a out-of-hospital cardiac arrest will be performed with tele-supervision.

study_pop.textblock: 30 critically ill patients suffering from acute cardiopulmonary resuscitation will be included in this study. POCUS will be performed with tele-supervision.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Patients with prehospital cardiac arrest, where POCUS is considered during cardiac pulmonary resuscitation, will be included.
Exclusion Criteria:
- under the age of 18,
- if POCUS is not considered or if POCUS will lead to a delay of live-saving treatment or transportation.
- pregnant patients
- patients with a body-mass-index (BMI) above 35 kg/m2

overall_official.last_name: Department of Anaesthesia & General Intensive Care

facility.name: Medical University of Vienna, Department of Anaesthesia & General Intensive Care
